review_blob: Overcarbonated (slight bottle explosion). Hazy with lots of sediment. Dark Amber. Nice hoppy nose. Alcohol dominates on the palate. Not well balanced
Soapy foam (large bubbles), nice fresh hop aroma. Taste mainly early boil hops paired with slight acidity. A little thin due to low abv but overall quite nice.
Bottle from Hkeren. Pours nice orange with a white head. Pine, gooseberries, citrus, slight tropical fruit and banana. Hop forward. Very nice.
Deep orange with diminishing off white head. Lots of citrus (lime and grapefruit) and resin in the aroma. Lots of grapefruity bitterness. Interesting.

Bottle. Pours chestnut with nice off white head and decent lacing.

Aroma: fruity, yeast, malt, caramel
Taste: fresh with very slight sourness and alcohol.
Thin and medium carbonation.

Overall quite refreshing despite abv

Bottle from Kihoskh. 
Pours amber with a small white head. 
Lots of fresh grapefruit, resin, pine and fresh hops in the aroma. Massive bitterness that numbs the mouth after half a bottle. 
Thin mouthfeel and light balanced carbonation. 
Interesting extreme brew, lots of great hop flavour yet quite unbalanced.

Bottle from Kihoskh

Appearance: Pours beatiful golden, slightly hazy with a white, deminishing head

Aroma: Banana, orange, wheat and honey

Taste:  Lots of sweetness and a slight metallic note and a little hoppy bitterness at the end.

Mouthfeel: Thin, soft carbonation, Slight bitterness at the end.

Pours hazy amber with nice offwhite head. 
Aroma -  Fresh hops, grapefruit, raspberry and passion fruit (very fruity) 
Balanced bitterness and light sweetness
Soft, light carbonation.
Overall very fruity and balanced IPA
beer_name: Mikkeller Single Hop Nelson Sauvin IPA

review_blob:
(Bottle) Pours blonde almost orange. Initially very large offwhite head but falls quickly.

Aroma: citrus, hops, bisquit, malt (almost wheaty) and belgian yeast.
Flavor: Medium bitterness,  alchohol, spice.
Overall: Refreshing, drinkable but doesnt leave a lot to remember

bottle. Pours light hazy yellow with good sized (and somewhat lasting) white head. Nice soft carbonation. Lemony aroma with a touch of banana. Aroma is very characteristic, and some people might not like this. Taste also dominated by fresh lemon notes as well as a nice wheat base. Some resemblence to Hoegaarden, though slightly "fuller" taste. All in all quite simple, but very nice.

Bottle- Beautiful hazy amber color. Small but fine light beige head. Fruity aroma with noticable and somewhat whisky-like alcohol finish. Very straight-forward taste with a hint of caramel. Very fine carbonation. All in all quickly forgotten and below usual standard for this brewery.

bottle. Black colour with medium sized, beige head. Very nice malty aroma. Very smooth texture and soft carbonation. Notes of espresso. liqourice, malt and a hint of smoke. Good balance between sweetness and bitterness. Overall a nice brew.

33cl Bottle. Just as good as everybody claims. Fantastic aroma. Nice and "warm" taste with a touch of plum and caramel. Only a slight (warming) taste of alcohol (considering the %). A very complex beer that you can enjoy again and again (and again)
